gmd:hierarchyLevelName.gco:CharacterString: Highest level of data collection, from a common set of sensors or instrumentation, usually within the same research project

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - Nitrate isotopes from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Nitrogen and Oxygen isotope ratios of dissolved nitrate Dataset Description: <p>Isotope Analysis conducted using the Denitrifier Method on all samples received with nitrate concentrations greater than 0.30 uM nitrate.&nbsp; Nitrite removal performed where noted in the comments section.</p><p><strong>DMO Note:</strong> Revised data were served on 12 March 2014. &nbsp;Orginal data were served in March&nbsp;2013.</p><p>These data have restricted access. Please contact the PI.</p><p>Please note that data may not be final, pending intercalibration&nbsp;results and further analysis. If you are interested in following&nbsp;changes to US GEOTRACES data, there is an RSS feed available&nbsp;from the <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/project/2066" target="_blank">GEOTRACES-NAT</a> project page.</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Sampling and Analytical Methodology: &nbsp;</strong>Seawater samples were processed in accordance with the published Denitrifier Method (citation provided below under Related Files and References). &nbsp;All isotopes analyses were performed on a MAT253 Thermo IRMS equipped with a custom-sample preparation system. &nbsp;With this system, we were able to achieve an overall standard deviation of 0.04 per mil for d15N-NO3 analyses and 0.09 per mil for d18O-NO3 analyses.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0960802 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=0960802

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Geosciences M52 Guyot Hall

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34459.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: dimensionless Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34460.rdf Name: cruise_name Units: dimensionless Description: project designated cruise name http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34461.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES station number http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34463.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34464.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: latitude; North is positive http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34465.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: longitude; East is positive http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34466.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34467.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34468.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34469.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34470.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-mm-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSZ Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34471.rdf Name: date Units: unitless Description: date of sampling; gmt date http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34472.rdf Name: sample_id Units: unitless Description: PI provided sample identification incorporating station-cast-bottle numbers http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34473.rdf Name: d15N_NO3 Units: per mil (ppt) vs. air Description: Nitrogen isotopic composition (15N/14N) of nitrate relative to atmospheric N2 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34474.rdf Name: d15N_NO3_sd Units: per mil (ppt) vs. air Description: standard deviation of measured Nitrogen isotopic composition (15N/14N) of nitrate relative to atmospheric N2 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34475.rdf Name: d18O_NO3 Units: per mil (ppt) vs. SMOW Description: Oxygen isotopic composition (18O/16O) of nitrate relative to SMOW (Vienna Standard Mean Ocean Water) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34476.rdf Name: d18O_NO3_sd Units: per mil (ppt) vs. SMOW Description: standard deviation of measured Oxygen isotopic composition (18O/16O) of nitrate http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34477.rdf Name: comment Units: unitless Description: comments pertaining to the sample http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/34505.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. PI-supplied values differed those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file and are reported as depth_PI

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: project designated cruise name; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.
PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: latitude; North is positive; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: longitude; East is positive; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: date of sampling; gmt date; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: PI provided sample identification incorporating station-cast-bottle numbers; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Nitrogen isotopic composition (15N/14N) of nitrate relative to atmospheric N2; General Description: delta 15N of dissolved nitrate relative to atmospheric N2

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of measured Nitrogen isotopic composition (15N/14N) of nitrate relative to atmospheric N2; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.

PI-supplied Description: Oxygen isotopic composition (18O/16O) of nitrate relative to SMOW (Vienna Standard Mean Ocean Water); General Description: Oxygen isotopic composition (18O/16O) of nitrate. This property is reported as the relative quantity delta18O in units of per mil vs. VSMOW (Vienna Standard Mean Ocean Water)

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of measured Oxygen isotopic composition (18O/16O) of nitrate; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: comments pertaining to the sample; General Description: free text comments, may only have meaning to submitting PI

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. PI-supplied values differed those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file and are reported as depth_PI; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Sampling and Analytical Methodology: &nbsp;</strong>Seawater samples were processed in accordance with the published Denitrifier Method (citation provided below under Related Files and References). &nbsp;All isotopes analyses were performed on a MAT253 Thermo IRMS equipped with a custom-sample preparation system. &nbsp;With this system, we were able to achieve an overall standard deviation of 0.04 per mil for d15N-NO3 analyses and 0.09 per mil for d18O-NO3 analyses.</p>

<p><strong>Data Processing: &nbsp;</strong>Individual data points have been averaged with standard deviations reported.&nbsp; Please see papers cited under Related Files and References for equations applied to derive final data.</p><p><strong>Related files and references:</strong><br /><br />Sigman, D. M., K. L. Casciotti, M. Andreani, C. Barford, M. Galanter, and J. K. Bohlke, A bacterial method for the nitrogen isotopic analysis of nitrate in seawater and freshwater, Analytical Chemistry, 73, 17, 4145-4153, (2001).</p><p>Casciotti, K. L., D. M. Sigman, M. Galanter Hastings, J. K. Bohlke, and A. Hilkert, Measurement of the oxygen isotopic composition of nitrate in seawater and freshwater using the denitrifier method, Analytical Chemistry, 74, 19, 4905-4912, (2002).</p><p>Granger, J., and D. M. Sigman, Removal of nitrite with sulfamic acid for nitrate N and O isotope analysis with the denitrifier method, Rapid Communications in Mass Spectrometry, 23, 3753-3762, (2009)<br /><br />&nbsp;</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Short Name:Niskin bottle Instrument Description: A Niskin bottle (a next generation water sampler based on the Nansen bottle) is a cylindrical, non-metallic water collection device with stoppers at both ends. The bottles can be attached individually on a hydrowire or deployed in 12, 24 or 36 bottle Rosette systems mounted on a frame and combined with a CTD. Niskin bottles are used to collect discrete water samples for a range of measurements including pigments, nutrients, plankton, etc. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0412/
